greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Period 5: repeat [1,-1,1,-1,0].
comment: C(n) := a(n+4) appears in the formula 2*exp(2*Pi*n*i/5) = (A(n) + B(n)*phi) + (C(n) + D(n)*phi)*sqrt(2 + phi)*i, with the golden section phi, i = sqrt(-1) and A(n) = A164116(n+5), B(n) = A080891(n) and D(n) = A010891(n+3) for n >= 0. See a comment on A164116(n+5). - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 26 2014
With offset 1 this is a strong elliptic divisibility sequence t_n as given in [Kimberling, p. 16] where x = -1, y = 1, z = 1. - _Michael Somos_, Oct 17 2018
reference: Arthur Gill, Linear Sequential Circuits, McGraw-Hill, 1966, Eq. (17-10).
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-1,-1,-1,-1).
C. Kimberling, Strong divisibility sequences and some conjectures, Fib. Quart., 17 (1979), 13-17.
formula: Euler transform of length 5 sequence [-1, 1, 0, -1, 1]. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 17 2015
a(n) = -a(-2-n) = a(n+5) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 17 2015
a(5*n) = a(5*n + 2) = 1, a(5*n + 1) = a(5*n + 3) = -1, a(5*n + 4) = 0 for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Nov 27 2019
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(1 + x^2)/(1 + x + x^2 + x^3 + x^4), {x, 0, 100}], x] (* _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, May 31 2015 *)
a[ n_] := (-1)^Mod[n, 5] Sign @ Mod[n + 1, 5]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jun 17 2015 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 06 2009
